discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The malicious code installed on a computer without the user's knowledge to acquire information and send it to the attacker remotely is called a Trojan. You cannot remotely access a computer with spyware

questions.question_text: The Malicious code that is installed on the computer without user's knowledge to acquire information from the user's machine and send it to the attacker who can access it remotely is called:

choices.B: Established connection attempts targeted at the vulnerable services

discussion.content:
No, please read a carefully
"DECREASE in network usage"
A worm INCREASE network usage, so correct answer is C

Selected Answer: D
I think it's all of the above. Because today's worms can already consume network resources and attack services, and can also cause computer crashes
Worms typically cause harm to their host networks by consuming bandwidth and overloading web servers. So the answer cant be All the above.
The answer is all of the above.
I think that the right answer is all the above. It´s very ambogous

comments.content: Please dont write nonsense here if you dont know the answer. Out of the 4 answers A is the most suitable one. Its as simple as that.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT one of the common techniques used to detect Insider threats:

choices.A: Spotting an increase in their performance
choices.B: Observing employee tardiness and unexplained absenteeism
choices.D: Spotting conflicts with supervisors and coworkers

questions.question_text: Quantitative risk is the numerical determination of the probability of an adverse event and the extent of the losses due to the event. Quantitative risk is calculated as:

choices.D: Significant Risks X Probability of Loss X Loss

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Quantitative risk is calculated as the product of the probability of loss and the loss itself. This formula provides a numerical value that represents the expected impact of a risk event. Mathematically, it is expressed as:

Quantitative Risk = (Probability of Loss) × (Loss)

This calculation helps organizations prioritize risks based on their potential financial impact and make informed decisions about risk mitigation strategies. The other options do not correctly represent the quantitative risk formula.

Selected Answer: A
Impact formula
% of being impacted by a event * Business impact = Risk

comments.content: It says what is NOT one of the techniques rather than what IS a technique

discussion.content: ECIH v3 page 1333 : After detecting an incident, incident responders must isolate the affected systems. Answer is A.

choices.A: Placing malicious users in quarantine network, so that attack cannot be spread
choices.B: Preventing malicious users from accessing unclassified information
choices.C: Disabling the computer systems from network connection
